I did it to keep the behaviour of the LocalStreamEnvironment class. It says:

When this environment is instantiated, it uses a default parallelism of {@code 1}. The default parallelism can be set via {@link #setParallelism(int)}. and it was explicitly calling setParallelism(1) irrespective of the DEFAULT_PARALLELISM.defaultValue(). If you think its fine to just use the DEFAULT_PARALLELISM.defaultValue(), which is 1 btw, I can remove all the mingling with parallelism in here.
It should be fine to simplify it. 👌
We should mention that the Configuration is (potentially) "layered" on top of a base configuration or merged with it.
Not necessarily. It is more to verify that we can pass parallelism that way as well. I can revert.
